maml:description.maml:para: Connect to RES Automation Manager SQL Database.
Sets up a connection to a RES Automation Manager SQL Database. The connection is saved in a variable called RESAM_DB_Connection. You can only connect to one database at a time.
Name of the SQL datasource to connect to.
Name of the RES Automation Manager Database.
Credentials for the connection. Accepts PSCredentials or a username. The user must have read privileges on the database. If omitted, the default credentials will be used.
Returns the connection object.
Name of the SQL datasource to connect to.
Name of the RES Automation Manager Database.
Credentials for the connection. Accepts PSCredentials or a username. The user must have read privileges on the database. If omitted, the default credentials will be used.
Returns the connection object.

maml:alert.maml:para: Author : Michaja van der Zouwen Version : 1.0 Creation Date : 25-6-2015

dev:remarks.maml:para: Sets up a connection to database 'RES-AM' on the default SQL Instance on 'SRV-SQL-01'. A credential prompt will appear to ask for the password of user 'RES-AM'.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Without credential prompt --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: C:\PS> $Cred = Get-Credential C:\PS> Connect-RESAMDatabase -DataSource SRV-SQL-01\RES -DatabaseName RES-AM -Credential $Cred -Passthru

dev:remarks.maml:para: Sets up a connection to database 'RES-AM' on the 'RES' Instance on SQL server 'SRV-SQL-01'. The connection object will be displayed.

StatisticsEnabled : False AccessToken : ConnectionString : Server=SRV-SQL-01\RES;Database=RES-AM;uid=RES-RO;Integrated Security=False; ConnectionTimeout : 15 Database : RES-AM DataSource : SRV-SQL-01\RES PacketSize : 8000 ClientConnectionId : bddb9f2b-7e10-42b0-acf4-ceac7fd5dc2d ServerVersion : 10.50.6220 State : Open WorkstationId : PC1234 Credential : FireInfoMessageEventOnUserErrors : False Site : Container :

maml:description.maml:para: Disconnect from the RES Automation Manager Database.
Closes the connection to a RES Automation Manager Database and discards the global variable.

maml:alert.maml:para: Author : Michaja van der Zouwen Version : 1.0 Creation Date : 25-6-2015

dev:remarks.maml:para: Closes connection to the currently connected database.

maml:description.maml:para: Get RES Automation Manager Agent objects.
Get RES Automation Manager Agent objects from the RES Automation Manager Database.
Name of the Agent.
GUID of the Agent.
Team object or guid of the team the agent should be member of.
Retreive full information (adapter information etc.).
Status of the agent. Values can be Online or Offline.
List agents that have duplicates.
Name of the Agent.
GUID of the Agent.
Team object or guid of the team the agent should be member of.
Retreive full information (adapter information etc.).
Status of the agent. Values can be Online or Offline.
List agents that have duplicates.

maml:alert.maml:para: Author : Michaja van der Zouwen Version : 1.0 Creation Date : 25-6-2015

dev:remarks.maml:para: Displays full information on RES Automation Manager agent PC1234.

Name : PC1234 Status : Online OSName : Microsoft Windows 10 Enterprise OSServicePack : FreeSpace(GB) : 29,42 MACAddress : 90:1B:0E:28:95:68 IPAddress : 192.168.10.213 PrimaryTeam : Team1 Teams : {Team1, Team2}
Displays default information on online agents that are a member of team 'Team1'.
Gets agent PC1234 and retreives the last five jobs that ran on it.
Displays all agent objects that have duplicates in the database.
Lists all duplicate agents

maml:description.maml:para: Get RES Automation Manager Audit information.
Get RES Automation Manager audit information from the RES Automation Manager Database.
Filter audits based on an action. Allowed values are:
- Add - Delete - Edit - Edit (details) - Other - Primary Team changed - Register - Sign in - Sign out
Display audits made by a specific Windows account.
Display last 'n' audits.
Filter audits based on an action. Allowed values are:
- Add - Delete - Edit - Edit (details) - Other - Primary Team changed - Register - Sign in - Sign out
Display audit trail from a start date.
Display audit trail up to an end date.
Display audits made by a specific Windows account.
Filter audits based on an action. Allowed values are:
- Add - Delete - Edit - Edit (details) - Other - Primary Team changed - Register - Sign in - Sign out
Display audits made by a specific Windows account.
Display last 'n' audits.
Display audit trail from a start date.
Display audit trail up to an end date.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Displays information on all Primary Team changes in the last four days.
Displays all audit information in february of 2015.
Displays the last 10 audits made by user DOMAIN\User123.

maml:description.maml:para: Get RES Automation Manager Job objects.
Get RES Automation Manager Job objects from the RES Automation Manager Database. A Job is a child to the MasterJob and contains the tasks run by the MasterJob per agent.
An agent a job has been scheduled to.
GUID of the MasterJob you wish to view the childjobs of.
The GUID of the job itself.
Returns jobs with a certain status.
By default only the last 1000 jobs will be returned. If more are required use this parameter to specify the correct amount or enter 0 for all jobs.
Retreive full information (Task information etc.).
An agent a job has been scheduled to.
GUID of the MasterJob you wish to view the childjobs of.
The GUID of the job itself.
Returns jobs with a certain status.
By default only the last 1000 jobs will be returned. If more are required use this parameter to specify the correct amount or enter 0 for all jobs.
Retreive full information (Task information etc.).

maml:alert.maml:para: Author : Michaja van der Zouwen Version : 1.0 Creation Date : 25-6-2015

dev:remarks.maml:para: Displays information on RES Automation Manager Jobs of the MasterJobs whose descriptions start with 'Create'.
Displays information on RES Automation Manager Jobs of MasterJob 'Start Services' that are currently active.
Display full information on the last 10 Jobs that ran on agent 'PC1234'.

maml:description.maml:para: Get RES Automation Manager MasterJob objects.
Get RES Automation Manager MasterJob objects from the RES Automation Manager Database. A MasterJob is a scheduled Module, Project or Runbook.
Description of the MasterJob.
GUID of the MasterJob.
The Team(s) or Agent(s) the job was scheduled on.
The GUID of the Module, Project or Runbook that was scheduled.
The GUID of a runbook job.
Only return MasterJobs that are in a certain state.
Returns a single MasterJob with a certain startdate/time. Input can be either a string or a DateTime object.

By default only main MasterJobs are returned. These are the jobs as shown in the console. With this parameter you can query jobs that were invoked by a runbook. In the console these can be found by opening a runbook job and clicking the 'Jobs' tab.
By default only the last 1000 jobs will be returned. If more (or less) are required use this parameter to specify the correct amount.
Retreive full information (Task information etc.).
Description of the MasterJob.
GUID of the MasterJob.
The Team(s) or Agent(s) the job was scheduled on.
The GUID of the Module, Project or Runbook that was scheduled.
The GUID of a runbook job.
Only return MasterJobs that are in a certain state.
Returns a single MasterJob with a certain startdate/time. Input can be either a string or a DateTime object.

By default only main MasterJobs are returned. These are the jobs as shown in the console. With this parameter you can query jobs that were invoked by a runbook. In the console these can be found by opening a runbook job and clicking the 'Jobs' tab.
By default only the last 1000 jobs will be returned. If more (or less) are required use this parameter to specify the correct amount.
Retreive full information (Task information etc.).

dev:remarks.maml:para: Displays information on RES Automation Manager MasterJobs whose descriptions start with 'Create'.

maml:description.maml:para: Schedules a new job for a RES Automation Manager module, project or runbook.

Schedules a new job for a RES Automation Manager module, project or runbook. This command makes use of the REST API and will require a dispatcher with the WebAPI enabled. This also requires a RES AM account that has sufficient rights to read modules, projects and runbooks and can schedule jobs.
Name of the dispatcher with the WebAPI enabled.
The RES AM user account name or it's credentials.
A description for the job. If not entered the name of the scheduled object will be used.
The agents or teams the job should run on. Use either a comma separated list of names or an array of agent or team objects.
Name of a module or module object to schedule.
Date/Time the job should start. When omitted the job will be scheduled immediately.
Use local time (Default).
Use Wake-on-LAN when the job starts.
Use the default values for all required parameters. Cannot be used in combination with the Parameters parameter.

A hashtable of required parameters for the job. When omitted the user will be prompted for required parameter values. You can find the required parameters by using the RequiredParameters property on the module, project or runbook you're scheduling. Cannot be used in combination with the UseDefaults parameter.
Name of the dispatcher with the WebAPI enabled.
The RES AM user account name or it's credentials.
A description for the job. If not entered the name of the scheduled object will be used.
The agents or teams the job should run on. Use either a comma separated list of names or an array of agent or team objects.
Name of a project or project object to schedule.
Date/Time the job should start. When omitted the job will be scheduled immediately.
Use local time (Default).
Use Wake-on-LAN when the job starts.
Use the default values for all required parameters. Cannot be used in combination with the Parameters parameter.

A hashtable of required parameters for the job. When omitted the user will be prompted for required parameter values. You can find the required parameters by using the RequiredParameters property on the module, project or runbook you're scheduling. Cannot be used in combination with the UseDefaults parameter.
Name of the dispatcher with the WebAPI enabled.
The RES AM user account name or it's credentials.
A description for the job. If not entered the name of the scheduled object will be used.
The agents or teams the job should run on. Use either a comma separated list of names or an array of agent or team objects.
Name of a runbook or runbook object to schedule.
Date/Time the job should start. When omitted the job will be scheduled immediately.
Use local time (Default).
Use Wake-on-LAN when the job starts.
Use the default values for all required parameters. Cannot be used in combination with the Parameters parameter.

A hashtable of required parameters for the job. When omitted the user will be prompted for required parameter values. You can find the required parameters by using the RequiredParameters property on the module, project or runbook you're scheduling. Cannot be used in combination with the UseDefaults parameter.
Name of the dispatcher with the WebAPI enabled.
The RES AM user account name or it's credentials.
A description for the job. If not entered the name of the scheduled object will be used.
The agents or teams the job should run on. Use either a comma separated list of names or an array of agent or team objects.
Name of a module or module object to schedule.
Date/Time the job should start. When omitted the job will be scheduled immediately.
Use local time (Default).
Use Wake-on-LAN when the job starts.
Use the default values for all required parameters. Cannot be used in combination with the Parameters parameter.

A hashtable of required parameters for the job. When omitted the user will be prompted for required parameter values. You can find the required parameters by using the RequiredParameters property on the module, project or runbook you're scheduling. Cannot be used in combination with the UseDefaults parameter.
Name of a project or project object to schedule.
Name of a runbook or runbook object to schedule.

maml:alert.maml:para: Author : Michaja van der Zouwen Version : 1.0 Creation Date : 25-6-2015

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Schedule module on two agents --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: C:\PS> New-RESAMJob -Dispatcher SRV-DISP-001 -Credential APIUser -Description 'New Test Job' -Who PC1234,PC5678 -Module 'Test Module'

dev:remarks.maml:para: Schedules the module 'Test Module' to run immediately on agent 'PC1234' and 'PC5678' using dispatcher 'SRV-DISP-001' as user 'APIUser'. There will be a prompt for the password.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Schedule project in one hour using parameters --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: C:\PS> Get-RESAMAgent | New-RESAMJob -Dispatcher SRV-DISP-001 -Credential $Cred -Description 'New Test Job' -Project 'Test Project' -Start (Get-Date).AddHours(1) -Parameters @{Param1='TEST'}

dev:remarks.maml:para: Schedules the project 'Test Project' to run in an hour on all agents using dispatcher 'SRV-DISP-001' with a credential object saved in a variable. Required parameter 'Param1' is set with value 'TEST'.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Schedule runbook at a specific time using default parameter values --------------------------

dev:remarks.maml:para: Schedules the runbook object in variable $runbook to run at 11:00PM today using dispatcher 'SRV-DISP-001' with a credential object saved in a variable. The description will be set to the name of the runbook and all required parameters will be set with default values.

maml:description.maml:para: Remove RES One Automation Agent from the database.
Removes RES One Automation Agents from the database. Agents should be offline. If duplicate agent names are detected you'll be prompted to choose between the following options:
- Abort all operations - Skip these agents and continue - Remove all agents - Remove all agents except the latest one
Optionally you can also remove job history for the agent(s).
Be aware that this command only removes the agent from the connected database, not from the remote machine itself. This command requires write privilleges on the database.
Name of agent to remove.
GUID of agent to remove.
How to handle duplicate agents. Values are:
- Abort : Abort all operations - Skip : Skip duplicate agents and continue - RemoveAll : Remove all duplicate agents - KeepLatest : Remove all duplicate agents except the latest one
Remove agents job history as well.
Name of agent to remove.
GUID of agent to remove.
Remove agents job history as well.
How to handle duplicate agents. Values are:
- Abort : Abort all operations - Skip : Skip duplicate agents and continue - RemoveAll : Remove all duplicate agents - KeepLatest : Remove all duplicate agents except the latest one

maml:alert.maml:para: Author : Michaja van der Zouwen Version : 1.0 Creation Date : 26-10-2015

dev:remarks.maml:para: Removes agent PC1234 from the connected database.
Removes agent PC1234 and its job history from the connected database.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Remove agents from a team without confirmation --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: C:\PS> $OldAgents = Get-RESAMTeam -Name 'Old Agents to be removed' C:\PS> Get-RESAMAgent -Team $OldAgents | Remove-RESAMAgent -Confirm:$False

dev:remarks.maml:para: Removes all agents from the team 'Old Agents to be removed' from the connected database. No confirmation will take place.
Removes all duplicate agents and their job history from the database except for the ones that were deployed the latest.
